data.title: What does tai mean?
data.meta_description: Definition of tai in the Definitions.net dictionary. Meaning of tai. What does tai mean? Information and translations of tai in the most comprehensive dictionary definitions resource on the web.
data.text:
Thai, Tai, Siameseadjective

of or relating to or characteristic of Thailand or its people

"Siamese kings"; "different Thai tribes live in the north"

tai

"Tai" can have different meanings depending on the context. 1. In Japanese, "Tai" is often used as a suffix meaning "body" or "unit." 2. In Mandarin Chinese, "tai" (t√†i) is an adverb that means extremely or too. 3. In Cantonese, "tai" means big or great. 4. "Tai" is also associated with various forms of martial arts such as Tai Chi, referring to the concept of the supreme ultimate. 5. It could also denote various types of fish such as sea bream in Japanese cuisine. So, the general definition of "Tai" varies based on language and context.

TAI

According to the U.S. Census Bureau, Tai is ranked #7553 in terms of the most common surnames in America.

The Tai surname appeared 4,401 times in the 2010 census and if you were to sample 100,000 people in the United States, approximately 1 would have the surname Tai.

86.1% or 3,793 total occurrences were Asian.

4.7% or 211 total occurrences were of two or more races.

3.8% or 170 total occurrences were White.

3.1% or 140 total occurrences were Black.

1.7% or 77 total occurrences were of Hispanic origin.

0.2% or 10 total occurrences were American Indian or Alaskan Native.
